byline.contributor: Noah Remnick contributed reporting from New Haven, and Benjamin Mueller from New York.

abstract: Dr Jonathan Holloway, Yale College's first black dean, has emerged as central figure in anti-racial discrimination protests that have swept Yale and other schools across United States; Holloway appears to be well-positioned to respond to racial fervor, but has struggled to reconcile sometimes competing roles of administrator, professor and sounding board for students.
lead_paragraph: Jonathan Holloway, the first black dean of Yale College, has striven to reconcile protesters and the administration, but has been criticized by some students as failing to do enough.

headline.main: Yale College Dean Torn by Racial Protests
headline.print_headline: Yale College Dean Is Torn by Racial Protests

snippet: Jonathan Holloway, the first black dean of Yale College, has striven to reconcile protesters and the administration, but has been criticized by some students as failing to do enough.
